# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceed. Provide an example

Here is the `wrap_string` function followed by an example of its usage:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    current_line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) <= text_width
            wrapped_text *= word * " "
            current_line_length += length(word) + 1
        else
            wrapped_text = wrapped_text[1:end-1] * "\n" * word * " "
            current_line_length = length(word) + 1
        end
    end
    return wrapped_text[1:end-1]
end

# Example:
example_text = "Julia is a high-level, high-performance, dynamic programming language."
println(wrap_string(example_text))
```

This function will parse the `example_text` and insert a newline character each time adding a new word would cause the line to exceed 10 characters. The result will be printed with the `println` function.
